The economy would likely experience a significant shift, as businesses and individuals would need to adapt to a new system of exchange. This could lead to new opportunities for innovation and growth.
The lack of currency could lead to a more equitable distribution of resources, as people would be forced to rely on their skills and abilities to trade rather than relying on wealth.
The absence of currency could lead to a more sustainable and environmentally friendly economy, as people would be less likely to engage in wasteful consumption and overproduction.
The lack of currency could lead to a more community-oriented society, as people would be more likely to rely on each other for support and assistance rather than relying on financial institutions.

The absence of currency could lead to a more decentralized and democratic society, as people would be less reliant on centralized financial institutions and more able to make decisions based on their own needs and values.
